result.execSummary:
The defendant Lloyd R. Pitzen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender-Fail/Update Information, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(4)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 11:05 am cases called-15CF19115CF199. Defendant Lloyd R. Pitzen in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Lloyd R. Pitzen in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Szilagyi. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 15CF191: 3 years WSP to be served as 1 years Initial Confinement and 2 years Extended Supervision, concurrent to any revocation the defendant is serving but consecutive to 15CF199. 15CF199-5-1/2 years WSP to be served as 2 1/2 years Initial Confinement and 3 years Extended Supervision,  consecutive to 15CF191. Credit of 102 days. CONDITIONS of ES: Any terms of agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.  Extradition costs to be included if incured by Waushara County. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Sentencing hearing on July 29, 2016 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Lloyd R. Pitzen
Current: PO Box 700, c/o Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963-0700 United States  (Effective: 06-10-2016)
Prior: W7883 State Road 21 And 73, Wautoma, WI 54982
Sentencing hearing on July 29, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

15CF191 & 15CF199 Cases called @ 1:43 p.m. Defendant Lloyd R. Pitzen in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Lloyd R. Pitzen in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA Blader - DE wishes to enter a plea but does not wish to proceed to sentencing at this time. The Court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 15CF191 - NC. 15CF199 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Atty Szilagyi requesting that the DE be sentenced before Judge Dutcher.  The defendant waives his right to a PSI. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the PSI. The Court orders the bond to continue.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi requesting a P/S hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on April 25, 2016 at 03:10 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD:  15CF-191 and 15CF-99: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court, appearing in person.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per SPD:  Requests add'l STC or P/S about 45 days out.  SPD still looking into some of the charges.  STC scheduled.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 03:10 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 15CF-191 and 15CF-199 - Both Cases Called @ 1:48 PM: Defendant Lloyd R. Pitzen in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing in person.  Defendant Lloyd R. Pitzen in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Both Complaints Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived as to both cases.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing as to both cases. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing as to both matters.   Per DA - some discovery still needs to be exchanged.  SPD agrees in light of pending revocation proceeding as well.  STC Scheduled as to both matters - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 09:15 am.
Initial appearance at 01-20-2016 01:45 pm
Defendant is prohibited from leaving the State of Wisconsin. Defendant must be equipped with a Global Positioning System Tracking Device through the Department of Corrections.
Defendant and Atty Szilagyi appear via video from the WC Jail

15CF191 & 15CF199 Cases called @ 1:01 p.m. Defendant Lloyd R. Pitzen in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting a separate $8000 Cash Bond on each case. Atty Szilagyi - no position as to bond as the defendant is on a probation hold. Court orders $8000 Cash Bond on each case. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Per Waushara County Dispatch - warrant never received by their department on this case
